Package xxl.core.cursors.sources

The package xxl.core.cursors.sources provides miscellaneous implementations of source operators.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ArrayCursor<E>
    An array-cursor constructs a cursor backed on an arbitrary object array.
    CollectionCursor<E>
    An collection-cursor constructs a cursor backed on an arbitrary collection.
    ContinuousRandomNumber
    A cursor providing a finite or infinite stream of randomly distributed double values given by the wrapped pseudo random number generator for continuous numbers.
    DiscreteRandomNumber
    A cursor providing a finite or finite stream of randomly distributed integer values given by the wrapped pseudo random number generator DiscreteRandomWrapper for discrete numbers.
    EmptyCursor<E>
    An empty cursor contains no elements, i.e., every call to its hasNext method will return false.
    Enumerator
    An enumerator returns an ascending or descending sequence of integer objects within an optional given range.
    Inductor<E>
    Given a tuple of start values (a0 to an) the inductor incrementally computes the value a(n+1+i) (i ≥ 0) by calling the function next with the parameters ai to a(n+i).
    Inductors
    This class provides ready to use inductors.
    Permutator
    The permutator 'returns' a permutation of a given input array or creates a permutation of integer values from 0 to n by lazy evaluation.
    Repeater<E>
    A repeater reiterates a given object n times.
    SingleObjectCursor<E>
    This class provides a cursor that returns a given object exactly one time.

Package xxl.core.cursors.sources Description

The package xxl.core.cursors.sources provides miscellaneous implementations of source operators. These operators create data instead of passing (and possibly processing) the data of an input iteration. Source operators using I/O operations to retrieve their data can be found in the subpackage xxl.core.cursors.sources.io.
